mdRecord.dcterms:title: Horse teeth clacker P600085
mdRecord.dcterms:description: We estimate age by examining the lower incisor teeth, as they are easily visible when the mouth is opened. In this specimen, all the incisors are permanent, indicated by their shape, size and the central groove on their labial surface. The presence of canine teeth and the wear of the teeth indicates the age of five or above years. Observe the cups are gone in the central and intermediate incisors. The cups are still present in the lateral incisors. Also, notice a small start of a hook on the upper corner incisors (UCI). Based on this information, estimate the age of this specimen.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Horses--Aging
Horses--Age determination
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
